bill_title: authorize counties to regulate certain section line hunting, fishing, and trapping practices.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize counties to regulate certain section line hunting, fishing, and trapping practices. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 41-9 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding the provisions of § § 41-9-1.1 and 41-9-1.3, the board of commissioners of any county may prohibit, restrict, or regulate hunting, fishing, and trapping on any public highway or public right-of-way located within the county. If the county takes such action and notifies the Department of Game, Fish and Parks before July first in any calendar, the county action is in effect for the remainder of the calendar year. Any such action and notification taken by the county after July first does not take effect until January first of the following calendar year. Any such action by the county remains in effect until rescinded or amended by the county. This section does not apply to the hunting of big game. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
